StreamFind

Source: vignettes/StreamFind.Rmd
StreamFind.Rmd

Introduction

The goal of StreamFind is to boost competences of researchers and graduate students for data analysis while promoting the use of open source software and deployment of algorithms and processing concepts from the scientific literature. The focus is the development and assembly of data processing workflows for different analytical data (e.g., mass spectrometry and Raman spectroscopy) and the application of the workflows in diverse fields (e.g., environmental and quality studies of the water cycle). The StreamFind can be used via R scripting or via the embedded shiny graphical user interface. See the articles for tutorials and usage examples.

  • Evaluation of wastewater ozonation with mass spectrometry

  • Comparison of different bovine serum albumin products

  • Detection of quality deviations in paracetamol products

Development

The life cycle of the StreamFind R package is experimental. Please contact us for questions, suggestions, issues or collaboration. Stay tuned!
